name: PushContainer
description: `Iterate.PushContainer` enables users to create a new item in the array.

props.name: path
props.doc: The path to the array to add the new item to.

props.name: itemPath
props.doc: The path to the item in a nested array, to add the new item to.

props.name: insertAt
props.doc: The index to insert the new item at.

props.name: data
props.doc: Prefilled data to be used by fields. The data will be put into this path: `/pushContainerItems/0`. Use `defaultData` when possible.

props.name: defaultData
props.doc: Prefilled data to be used by fields. The data will be put into this path: `/pushContainerItems/0`.

props.name: isolatedData
props.doc: Provide additional data that will be put into the root of the isolated data context (parallel to `/pushContainerItems/0`).

props.name: required
props.doc: If the fields inside the container are required.

props.name: bubbleValidation
props.doc: Prevent the form from being submitted when there are fields with errors inside the PushContainer.

props.name: preventUncommittedChanges
props.doc: Prevents uncommitted changes before the form is submitted. Will display an error message if user tries to submit without committing their changes.

props.name: showResetButton
props.doc: Show a button to clear the PushContainer data.

props.name: showOpenButtonWhen
props.doc: Define when the "open button" should be shown. Should be a function that returns a boolean.

props.name: variant
props.doc: Defines the variant of the container. Can be `outline`, `filled` or `basic`. Defaults to `outline`.

props.name: toolbar
props.doc: A custom toolbar to be shown below the container.

events.name: onCommit
events.doc: Will be called on a nested form context commit â€“ if validation has passed. The first parameter is the committed data object. The second parameter is an object containing a method to clear the internal data `{ clearData }`.
